009package imagingbook.common.mser;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianFilter;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.AffineMapping2D;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.Translation2D;
020import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
021import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
022import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
023import imagingbook.common.mser.components.Component;
024
025
026/**
027 * <p>
028 * Provides functionality to extract local affine frames from a given image.
029 * Assumes that the specified image has a white background (255) and black (0) objects.
030 * See Section 26.5 of [1] for a detailed description.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2022/11/19
038 * 
039 * @see AffineMapping2D
040 * @see ImageMapper
041 */
042public class LocalAffineFrameExtractor {        // TODO: needs testing!
043        
044        private static InterpolationMethod interpolMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
045        
046        private final ImageProcessor sourceIp;
047        private final int m;                                    // size of frame to extract (W = H = 2 m + 1)
048        private final double s;                                 // size ratio between outer and inner ellipse
049        private final boolean useAntiAliasingFilter;    
050        
051        /**
052         * Full constructor.
053         * @param sourceIp the image to extract frames from
054         * @param m size of the (square) frames to extract (W = H = 2 m + 1)
055         * @param s size ratio between outer and inner ellipse
056         * @param useAntiAliasingFilter turn anti-aliasing filter on or off
057         */
058        public LocalAffineFrameExtractor(ImageProcessor sourceIp, int m, double s, boolean useAntiAliasingFilter) {
059                this.sourceIp = sourceIp;
060                this.m = m;
061                this.s = s;
062                this.useAntiAliasingFilter = useAntiAliasingFilter;
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Short constructor.
067         * @param sourceIp the image to extract frames from
068         * @param m size of the (square) frames to extract (W = H = 2 m + 1)
069         */
070        public LocalAffineFrameExtractor(ImageProcessor sourceIp, int m) {
071                this(sourceIp, m, 1.5, true);
072        }
073        
074        /**
075         * Extracts a single local-affine frame for the specified
076         * MSER component.
077         * The extracted image has the same type as the original source image
078         * (passed to the constructor).
079         * 
080         * @param mser a MSER component
081         * @return the local-affine frame (instance of {@link ImageProcessor})
082         */
083        public ImageProcessor getLocalAffineFrame(Component<MserData> mser) {
084                MserData props = mser.getProperties();
085                double[] xc = props.getCenter().toDoubleArray(); //{mu10, mu01};
086                double[][] S = props.getCovarianceMatrix();
087                
088                EigenDecomposition ed = new EigenDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(S));
089                RealMatrix V = ed.getV();
090                RealMatrix D = ed.getD();
091                
092                for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
093                        D.setEntry(i, i, Math.sqrt(D.getEntry(i, i)));
094                }
095                
096                RealMatrix A = V.multiply(D).scalarMultiply(2.0 * s / m);
097                double detA = Matrix.determinant2x2(A.getData());
098
099                if (detA < 0) { // reflection
100                        RealMatrix reflect = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {{1,0},{0,-1}});
101                        A = A.multiply(reflect);        // undo reflection!!
102                }
103                
104                ImageProcessor ip2 = sourceIp.duplicate();
105                ip2.invert(); // makes the background black, objects white
106                
107                if (useAntiAliasingFilter) {
108                        GeometricEllipse ellipse = props.getEllipse();
109                        double dMax = s * ellipse.ra / m;       // scale ratio
110                        double sigma = 0;
111                        if (dMax > 1.5) {       // down-scaling, sample width increases by factor dScale
112                                sigma = (dMax - 1) * 0.5;       // factor 0.5 is ad hoc (full dMax blurs too much)
113                        }
114                        if (sigma > 0) {
115                                GaussianFilter gf = new GaussianFilter(sigma);
116                                gf.applyTo(ip2);
117                        }
118                }
119                
120                int frameSize = 2 * m + 1;
121                ImageProcessor laf = sourceIp.createProcessor(frameSize, frameSize);
122                
123                AffineMapping2D T1 = new Translation2D(-m, -m);
124                AffineMapping2D AA = new AffineMapping2D(A.getData());
125                AffineMapping2D T2 = new Translation2D(xc);
126                
127                AffineMapping2D M = T1.concat(AA).concat(T2);
128                ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(M, null, interpolMethod);
129                
130                mapper.map(ip2, laf);
131                
132                laf.invert(); // makes background white again           
133                return laf;
134        }
135
136}
